channel.title: Prison document
channel.description:
A documentary series that examines prisons and their purposes.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Prison discipline
item.description: This program takes a closer look at prison discipline. The listener hears a warden who deplores the passing of the lash. The program presents the dilemma of how to control hardened criminals and still rehabilitate them.
item.dc:creator: Flynn, Roy
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Classification and receiving center of a prison
item.description: This program examines the classification and receiving center of a prison system which has only recently experienced reform. The board discusses and interviews prisoners, and makes known their prison assignments.
item.dc:creator: Flynn, Roy
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Southern prison and road camp
item.description: This program takes the listener into a southern prison and road camp, follows the prisoners as they are loaded into a truck under armed guard, work on the highway, and return for the evening meal.
item.dc:creator: Flynn, Roy
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Treatment
item.description: This program studies some of the mechanics by which treatment is affected in a prison system geared to rehabilitation of inmates, and presents a group counseling session.
item.dc:creator: Flynn, Roy
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Development of penal philosophy
item.description: Traces the historical development of the concept of punishment for crime, establishes the current conflict in penal philosophy.
item.dc:creator: Florida State University
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Criminal behavior and mental illness
item.description: This program highlights a state system where the same agency administers prisons and mental hospitals because "criminal behavior and mental illness are merely different aspects of the total mental health picture"
item.dc:creator: Flynn, Roy
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Life in custody
item.description: This program considers the mechanics of day-to-day life in custody and notes the subtle distortion such activity takes on when related to punishment for crime.
item.dc:creator: Flynn, Roy
item.dc:subject: Sociology
